mixed-citation.named-content: Nomisia ameretatae Zamani & Chatzaki & Esyunin & Marusik 2021, sp. nov.
mixed-citation.article-title: One new genus and nineteen new species of ground spiders (Araneae: Gnaphosidae) from Iran, with other taxonomic considerations

tp:treatment-sec.p: The new species is most similar to N. ripariensis (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) and N. levyi Chatzaki, 2010 by having a similar tibial apophysis with a triangular protrusion and the tegulum extending prolaterally. It differs from them by the embolic division composed of a pike-like, straight embolus and a subtriangular terminal apophysis behind it (vs broad at base of embolus and with a claw-like terminal apophysis in N. ripariensis , see Chatzaki 2010 : figs 47–48, and small and vertical embolus connected to a long, transverse terminal apophysis in N. levyi , see Chatzaki 2010 : figs 28–29).
The specific epithet is a noun in the genitive case and refers to Ameretat, the Avestan language name of the Zoroastrian divinity concept of immortality.

p.tp:material-citation: Holotype IRAN • ♂ ; Tehran Province , Plant Pests and Diseases Research Institute park ; 7–22 Jun. 2000 ; Y.M. Marusik leg.; MMUE .

tp:treatment-sec.p: Habitus as in Fig. 17A–B . Total length 7.30. Carapace 3.38 long, 2.45 wide. Sternum 1.74 long, 1.60 wide. Eye sizes and interdistance of PMEs: AME = 0.12, ALE = 0.13, PME = 0.15, PLE = 0.13, PME–PME = 0.08. Carapace, sternum, labium, chelicerae and maxillae dark reddish brown; carapace with numerous dark lines radiating from fovea to submarginal area. Chelicera ( Fig. 17H ) with serrated retromarginal keel. Legs light brown, with annulations. Abdomen light gray, dorsally with distinct darker pattern medially and marginally, ventrally with two light brown tracheal marks. Anterior spinnerets dark reddish brown, slightly lighter in the apex. Posterior spinnerets slightly lighter than abdomen. Measurements of legs: I: 13.78 (3.48, 1.87, 3.16, 3.25, 2.02), II: missing, III: 8.32 (2.22, 1.17, 1.45, 2.10, 1.42), IV: 11.74 (3.15, 1.44, 2.50, 3.24, 1.41).

Fig. 17. Nomisia ameretatae sp. nov. , holotype, ♂ (MMUE). A–B . Habitus, dorsal and ventral views. C–D . Bulb, dorsal and retrolateral views. E–G . Palp, ventral, retroventral and retrolateral views. H . Chelicera, posterior view. I–K . Tibial apophysis, dorsal, retrolateral and ventral views. Scale bars: 0.2 mm, unless stated otherwise.

Palp as in Fig. 17C–G, I–K . Tibia with small, membranous retroventral apophysis and well sclerotized retrolateral one; retrolateral apophysis shorter than tibia, broader in central part than at the base, tip rounded, central part with conical process; cymbium 2.3 times as long as wide; tegulum with massive protrusion directed prolaterally; terminal apophysis subtriangular, well sclerotized, parallel to embolus, arising behind tegulum; embolus pike-like, oblique, directed at an almost 2 o’clock position.
Known only from the type locality in Tehran Province , northern Iran .
